intro: Canella alba, commonly known as white sand ginger, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and turmeric. The plant features aromatic, pale yellow flowers and has a distinctive, fragrant rhizome. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a waxy texture. Canella alba is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its potential medicinal properties.
